item.title: Barack Obama, Nancy Pelosi Yet To Endorse Kamala Harris For Presidential Job
item.description: Former President Barack Obama, former Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer have yet to make their stand clear on endorsing Kamala Harris for the Presidential nomination.

item.title: "Right Thing To Do": Indian-Americans On Biden Quitting Presidential Race
item.description: US President Joe Biden did the "right thing" by dropping out of the 2024 presidential race, prominent members of the Indian-American community have said, noting that this must have been a hard decision for him to make but one he took to put "America

item.title: As Kamala Harris Joins Presidential Race, Who Will Be Her Running Mate?
item.description: Hours after President Joe Biden announced his decision to step down from the 2024 race to the White House, Vice President Kamala Harris, in a statement on X, said was "honored to have the President's endorsement"

item.title: Kamala Harris, Trailblazer Eyeing America's Last Glass Ceiling
item.description: For years Kamala Harris faced criticism that she was not up to the job of being a heartbeat away from the US presidency. Now, she finds herself feted by Democrats as their best hope to stop Donald Trump's comeback.

item.title: Harris as president would be incredibly dangerous, says Tulsi Gabbard, calls her maidservant of Hillary Clinton
Starmer praises Biden’s ‘remarkable’ career after US election withdrawal
item.description:
Prime minister among UK political leaders to celebrate US president’s achievements and character

  • Joe Biden withdraws from 2024 presidential race – live
  • The tragedy and resilience of Joe Biden: a look back at a life in politics

Sir Keir Starmer says he respects Joe Biden’s decision to pull out of the US presidential election, describing the 81-year-old’s political career as “remarkable”.

The UK prime minister said: “I respect President Biden’s decision and I look forward to us working together during the remainder of his presidency.

Continue reading...
